website_summaries.verdict: Precision operation with a heavy-duty build quality.
pros: Similar to what professionals use on long, tough projects
A very quick and easy loading process to keep the gun fed with nails on the go
Rubber pads protect the roof during each impact
cons: Will misfire randomly after some extended use

customer_reviews.title: Still the best
customer_reviews.text: As a roofing contractor we have used them all over the years. The HPT/Metabo/Hitachi guns are still the longest lasting. Occasionally the bumper fails or even more rare a piston. But they are very easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla

customer_reviews.title: Still the Same !!
customer_reviews.text: Was leery at first, I didnt know Hitachi was no longer Hitachi.. so far it's been every bit as good as the original. So 2 thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Kris&Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Unstoppable
customer_reviews.text: Besides my own use of this nailer (no issues), a foolish acquaintance borrowed this from me, used it, and proceeded to leave it outside in the rain and snow for a season. It miraculously still works great. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Average Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Performance not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Performance of this gun is not as expected. Sadly the nails don't come out straight. Regardless of the size of nails used the gun sends them out crooked so you have to spend majority of your time putting caulking on those nails. This gun is fast but sadly not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: got this for my hubby as a gift. He loves it and makes work so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany B

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: This gun is working perfect I buy it again I like it
customer_reviews.author: Juan Jose Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a good nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast nailer worked great light weight and came with the air chuck connection.
customer_reviews.author: kelly m.

customer_reviews.title: Move On
customer_reviews.text: Gun leaked air and didn’t fire right. Kept jamming up also. Move on and get a different brand. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mind.of.Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Double nails too many times
customer_reviews.text: Seems wasteful to pull the trigger once and many times two nails come out
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Gun misfires a lot. As a roofing contractor you need good reliable tools hitachi is the best and even though they say this is still Hitachi but the name changed I have to say the quality also changed This is my first time using a gun under the name matabo and I must say it's not good. Wish I could get my money back but sadly return time has expired
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Wallace

product_meta.title: Metabo HPT Roofing Nailer, Pneumatic, Coil Roofing Nails from 7/8-Inch up to 1-3/4-Inch, 16 Degree Magazine (NV45AB2)
product_meta.description: Style:Roofing Nailer OnlyThe NV45AB2 1-3/4-Inch Roofing Nailer is used for various construction work such as the installation of asphalt roofing shingles and the installation of insulation boards. The NV45AB2 has a side load magazine. When only the best will do for roofing applications, choose the roofing nailer that has been sought after by professionals for decades.
feature_bullets: ROOFING NAILER: Ideal for installation of asphalt roofing shingles and insulation boards
FASTENERS: Accepts 16º wire coil roofing nails from 7/8-Inch to 1-3/4-Inch
EASY FASTENER INSTALLATION: Side loading magazine, convenient and easy for quick replenishment
DEPTH ADJUSTMENT: Tool-less depth of drive adjustment, for precision nailing/flush driving
LIGHTWEIGHT: At only 5.5 Lb., the NV45AB2 is lightweight and well balanced for easy maneuverability
CARBIDE TIPPED PUSH LEVER: Reduces wear
DURABLE: Pneumatic power feed and return, allows tool to operate in the harshest conditions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars130 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
